intro: Hieracium erythrogrammum, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems that are reddish in color, especially when mature. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Hieracium erythrogrammum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas.
